title: IFSTA HazMat First Responder 6
description:
The Hazardous Materials for First Responders, 6th Edition, Manual will prepare first responders to take appropriate initial actions at hazardous materials spills or releases and weapons of mass destruction incidents. This edition provides fire and emergency services personnel with the information necessary to meet the job performance requirements (JPRs) of NFPA 470, Hazardous Materials/Weapons of Mass Destruction (WMD) Standard for Responders, 2022 Edition. This app supports the content provided in our Hazardous Materials for First Responders, 6th Edition Manual. Included FREE in this app are Flashcards, and Chapter 1 of the Exam Prep. 

Flashcards:
Review all 448 key terms and definitions found in all 16 chapters of the Hazardous Materials for First Responders, 6th Edition, Manual with flashcards. Study selected chapters or combine the deck together. This feature is FREE for all users. 

Exam Prep:
Use the 729 IFSTAⓇ-validated Exam Prep questions to confirm your understanding of the content in the Hazardous Materials for First Responders, 6th Edition, Manual. The Exam Prep covers all 16 chapters of the Manual. Exam Prep tracks and records your progress, allowing you to review your exams and study your weaknesses. In addition, your missed questions are automatically added to your study deck. This feature requires an in-app purchase. All users have free access to Chapter 1. 

This app covers the following topics: 

1. Introduction to Hazardous Materials 
2. Recognize and Identify the Presence of Hazmat 
3. Initiate Protective Actions 
4. Identify Potential Hazards 
5. Identify Potential Hazards - Containers 
6. Identify Criminal or Terrorist Activity 
7. Planning the Initial Response 
8. Incident Command System and Action Plan Implementation 
9. Emergency Decontamination 
10. Personal Protective Equipment 
11. Mass and Technical Decontamination 
12. Detection, Monitoring, and Sampling 
13. Product Control 
14. Victim Rescue and Recovery 
15. Evidence Preservation and Public Safety Sampling 
16. Illicit Laboratory Incidents
